name: Numida
headline: Working capital for African micro businesses
description: Numida provides working capital loans to African micro businesses. Instead of borrowing from informal lenders or family, micro business owners download the Numida app, apply in minutes, and receive capital within a day. We have figured out how to score and disburse unsecured loans to cash-based businesses that have no digital transaction history, while maintaining excellent collection rates. Since 2021 we have provided $23M in working capital to 32,000 businesses in East Africa.

founders.name: Mina Shahid, Founder
founders.description: Co-Founder and CEO of Numida. I'm a two time founder and along with Numida's CTO I previously worked on another lending company in Ghana that failed. I'm Egyptian and Canadian and have lived and worked in Uganda, Ghana, Zambia and Colombia. I fundamentally believe that the growth of micro and small businesses in Africa is the key to economic prosperity for hundreds of millions of people!

founders.name: Catherine Denis, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and COO of Numida. I have lived and worked in Uganda, Rwanda, Burkina Faso, Mali, Haiti and Colombia for 8+ years figuring out how to build teams, build robust processes, and get things done in challenging environments. I hold an MPA/ID from the Harvard Kennedy School and graduated in Systems Design Engineering from the University of Waterloo. As a French Canadian, I always welcome the opportunity to work or connect in my mother tongue.

generated_description:
Numida is a fintech company based in Kampala, Uganda, on a mission to provide working capital to African micro businesses. Founded in 2016, Numida offers unsecured loans to entrepreneurs who might otherwise rely on informal financial options, like family or local lenders. With a straightforward app, users can apply for a loan in minutes and receive funding within 24 hours.

What makes Numida particularly innovative is its ability to score and issue loans to cash-based businesses without a digital transaction history. This financial inclusion has led to impressive results: since its inception, Numida has disbursed $23 million across 32,000 businesses in East Africa, maintaining excellent collection rates along the way.

As part of the renowned Y Combinator Batch W22, Numida employs a dedicated team of 115 people and is backed by notable investors, including Group Partner Tom Blomfield. They are also regulated under the Uganda Microfinance Regulatory Authority.

The loan application process is user-friendly—just download the app, upload your national ID, share basic business details, and you could see funds in your account the next day. Entrepreneurs like Sharon Akumu have shared success stories, noting how Numida's financing has transformed their businesses.

For anyone interested in empowering their small business within the African market, Numida offers a straightforward pathway to essential funding—no more informal loans and no more waiting in uncertainty. If you're looking for quick and reliable capital, Numida might just be the solution you've been searching for.

To learn more or apply for a loan, visit their website at [Numida](https://numida.com).
